Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: gabrieltravels
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our birthday and anniversary here. Grounds are well cared for , the swimming pools where great , one of them wasn't heated due to the heater was broke and they are awaiting part. the hot tubs where very relaxing. Cheeks is a bar and place you can great food and opens at 11 am. they Also have Lakeside Restaurant that serves breakfast every day and are open for dinner except Tue and Wed .Loved it so I got us a membership so could enjoy more and we are only 1/2 hour away. This place is a gem. A Spa, which I highly recommend. You can even rent bicycles or golf cart but must use cash for that.

Reviews.Title: “Surreal Experience”
Reviews.Author: goingcoastal1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited our first nudist resort last weekend. Cypress Cove. We’ve really enjoyed the nude beach experience, but visiting Cypress Cove has added a whole new perspective to our relatively new naturalist endeavors. We went on a Sunday and arrived late morning. A bit apprehensive, the apprehension began to shed off as early as the front gate. We would readily shed our closes about a half hour later. The lady at the gate was very pleasant and friendly. She was very welcoming and without her knowing she was making us feel special and comfortable from the very beginning. The office was busy with people checking out but it gave us an opportunity to watch the way the staff interacted with the people waiting to be helped. I told my wife that for the first time I felt a little self-conscious wearing cloths and she felt the same way. Once we signed in at the office another very friendly and inviting lady took us on a brief and informative tour. Again we felt self-conscious being clothed and wondering around the pools and other various places in the resort. We both got a kiss from a very nice lady at the salon… chocolate kiss, that is, as we joked about having my hair done (buffed). Well, I could go on and on about how at home we felt. We took out a paddle boat around the lake. We sat by one of the pools and had our lunch. We spent time lying around and walking around, all in the buff. I’d like to fish next time. Others were fishing. I’m sure that this resort is not like other extravagant and expensive resorts. It doesn’t have the “polished brass” look, but is clean and inviting. It was surreal to be nude all day. It was relaxing and enjoyable to experience the freedom of nudism. But, from our perspective what we enjoyed the most about Cypress Cove on our day visit, were friendly people. The people on staff and the patrons were the best asset that this resort has.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another fabulous stay at Cypress Cove”
Reviews.Author: Kalamadrew
Reviews.Content: I fear that people will get bored by my several reviews of Cypress Cove. In short, as far as we are concerned, The Cove is so great we won't even look for another resort in FL. It's easy to get to, has a million things going on each day, has great staff, and they bend over backwards to be helpful and take care of your needs. This time we stayed for 10 days. The weather was fantastic with rain only part of one day and sunny 80's the rest of the time. We played Petanque every day in the afternoon and walked the perimeter several times during our stay. Mostly we relaxed and let the tension of our work leave us and the relaxation wash over us. (we call it letting the air out of the balloon.) We went to another great show by the Cove Players. We found out they put over 100 hours of practice into this years program. The show with a never ending hot and cold buffet is only $24 per person including tip. There are too many details to list that delighted us again this time. I do have to say that the Villa rooms are tired and in need of detail upgrades but we spent so little time in our room it was no big thing. We're going back again!

Reviews.Title: “Clothes-free vacationing at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: luckeedux
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling in the Orlando area and are looking for a relaxing, friendly nudist resort to stay at, Cypress Cove is THE place. Friendly staff, fabulous accommodations, fun activities and great food; this resort has the amenities you look for in any well established and highly rated resort and spa. Massage therapists on had to help you unwind, jacuzzis, tennis courts, swimming pool, lake for boating, full service restaurant as well as a pool side cafe and grill. Having been in the nudist travel business over the last 20 plus year, i can tell you that Cypress Cove has remained consistent in service and high on my list of places to visit when I am in the area- for business or pleasure,

Reviews.Title: “Would liked to have been able to stay longer”
Reviews.Author: jtfnewbern
Reviews.Content: We camped here for a week. Lived it. Lots to do. They don't Nicole dime you for everything tennis courts. Two pools. Two hot tubs. Pond. Three restaurants. Massage. Family oriented. Fishing. 9 hole golf. A great value.

Reviews.Title: “Camping, free and fun...”
Reviews.Author: iluvtnb
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Cyprus Cove, a number of times now, and always enjoy going back. Helpful and welcoming staff, good solid American food at reasonable prices, and the clothing optional experience is perfect, with a very large community pool, and a smaller, quiet pool, for those who simply want to get some deep rest. there is a good range of spa services, and a shop for the few things you need that you might have forgotten. Finally, for those who enjoy the social part of nudity, there are lots of activities, and plenty of people who will give you space, but, also, engage in conversation. We did not enjoy staying in the hotel, the one time we stayed there, because it was dated, and that is why I debated giving a four or five star rating. In all fairness, the buildings are older, and require an extra measure of TLC, as one would expect. There is an on-going attempt to keep the facility up-to-date, and, when all is said, they really do try, with room for improvement. We have found that there is a better alternative, which is to bring a tent for camping. The campsite is right on the edge of the lake, with a full 180 degree view of the water. The lake, especially in the morning as the sun comes up, is pure, beautiful, old Florida; the camp ground shaded, well-maintained, and insect-free. And, since the entire grounds is clothing free, where else can you camp in the buff, on the bluff? That experience is so wonderful, being natural, out in nature. It would quickly make a convert of anyone who has the slightest willingness to truly enjoy the freedom such an experience brings? Cypress Cove, is the place to do it! The cost is reasonable, and includes use of all of the facilities, and, again, the staff working out on the grounds, could not be more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nude Fun in the Sun!”
Reviews.Author: MnNgirl
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Cypress Cove. We were there this year (February) for "Parrot Head Lite" the winter version of their huge celebration in July. The party was a bit more subdued this year, but I think it was due mostly to the weather. It was warm (80) but overcast, so I am guessing that some folks stayed away thinking it would rain. Music at the pool Saturday afternoon and fellow party goers handing out jello shots made for a fun afternoon! We love the relaxed and friendly atmosphere of this place! The "regulars" and snowbirds that are there make visitors feel like part of the family. Our only complaint would be that while the weekend crowd was more diverse in age, the clientele is older, so there is not much for night life (with Parrot Head Lite weekend, we did hang out and dance at the poolside bar til after 11pm to some DJ music which was fun). Cypress does not have an "official" night club like Caliente or Paradise Lakes and they work hard to maintain a family friendly/AANR friendly resort. The upside is that Cypress is fine with guests bringing in their own coolers for drinks and snacks around the pool (Something that Caliente and Paradise don't allow) and they have a poolside bar/restaurant with great food too. The rooms are clean, but basic. The restaurant has great food and we ate all of our meals there for the weekend, so had a sampling of breakfast/lunch and dinner options. All of the staff are just first-rate and friendly. They learned our names and always greeted us with a smile! We had a lovely time!

Reviews.Title: “Always a great time”
Reviews.Author: Denshuman
Reviews.Content: We have been coming here on and off for 30 years. It always is a treat, always getting better. The treatment by the staff is wonderful and the inclusiveness at the tennis courts is always appreciated. We stayed in a villa, and it did have an odor that was bothersome. Other than that, it couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape”
Reviews.Author: Art B
Reviews.Content: Great, romantic getaway. Warm, sunny and friendly. Great workers, food, and a good value. It was the nudeapalooze weekend so it was a good time. I could not get in the second pool because it was cold.

Reviews.Title: “October 2011”
Reviews.Author: CRStravelers
Reviews.Content: This was another "trek" into a nudist place for my husband & I in the end of October (we ended up being there for their Halloween weekend celebration). I am getting used to this lifestyle of being nude anywhere you go but it has taken me a bit longer than others to remove my clothing and be natural. No one seems to care what anyone looks like and everyone is nude (it is a rule to have no clothing on in the gated area that surrounds the pools, hot tubs). It was a bit of an "older" I hesitate to use this title as we are all doing just that with every day that passes but we were a bit disapointed that it was mainly an older crowd. If I had to guess I woulld say that mainly the average age was 60+ although they were friendly and social group of folks. Seemed as though there were alot of people who had been coming there for a long time and knew eachother pretty well so it was a little uncomfortable being the somewhat of the "outsider group" of guests as we knew no one and we were traveling alone as a couple together. We stayed in the hotel type room which only had a small refridge so it made meal planing a bit difficult since we normally have done all inclusive places and dont always want to get dressed to go out to eat outside of the property. Food & beverages were available on site however. As for the property: It was very well maintained and had a beautiful lake with canoes and paddle boats, camping area for tenters near by the lakeside, 2 pools, an outdoor and an indoor hot tub area, 2 bars and a very nice restaurant on the property. They also had a clothing boutique (odd for a nudist resort) but nice souvenier type stuff, spa & fitness center as well. We did not use the spa or fitness center but they looked very nice if you are interested in doing those things. Very nice place overall, we met a few nice couples who we chatted with after the first day, we were there for 3 nights. The Halloween dinner dance party and costume contest was very nice. We dressed up and had a nice time, food was very good at the restaurant for the buffet & party. When visiting family in Florida outside of the Orlando "Mickey Mouse" zone we would definately go back there again. Just about a half hour away from the MCO Orlando airport and worth the trip for the nudist who wants to just shed everything and relax!!

Reviews.Title: “Great get away spot”
Reviews.Author: DJK1950
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned home from another wonderful vacation stay in our RV. It is only an hour away from home, so we go as often as we can. The RV camping rates are very reasonable and they include grounds fees for the two of us. We find it a great place to relax with friendly staff, beautiful grounds, and lots of activities to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Back from the cove”
Reviews.Author: Jerry K
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a week at the cove again. This is our 3rd visit and after staying at several others I have been spoiled at the Cove. RV sites are clean and well maintained. The food is excellent, the activities are well organized. Ted, don't change a thing. Will be back in the spring

Reviews.Title: “First Time Visitors to The Cove”
Reviews.Author: BevA60
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in the campground at Cypress Cove, and really enjoyed it. The people (residents, members, and other guests) are super friendly and helpful. People spoke whenever they passed, which made us feel very welcome. Gary, at Cheeks bar, is fantastic! He remembered our names, our favorite drinks, and where we were staying, after only one day! Lisa at the restaurant remembered us, as well. The campsites are nice and ours was very level. We have a small A-frame popup camper, which generated a lot of comments and looks from everyone who drove by; it's nice to be noticed! Several people stopped and talked with us about it, and we showed it to them. We definitely plan to return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to find relaxation and serenity!”
Reviews.Author: JustaGurlinFL
Reviews.Content: With a busy life and loud city living, Cypress Cove offers a relaxing atmosphere. There is so much to do in activities: tennis, chip n putt, patanque, paddle boats and much more. The rooms are very clean. The staff is very attentive and accommodating. We have stayed at the resort many times and have felt comfortable since the moment we entered the gates. I would recommend this resort for nudist new and old & young and old! Looking forward to another great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “2 day visits in a week”
Reviews.Author: Nytro
Reviews.Content: I gave Cypress Cove a rating of 4 and not a 5 ONLY because I didn't spend the night there, I was staying in the area with my family, who are not into nude recreation, so while they took in Disney on one day, and Universal on another, I made the short drive to "The Cove". The first day I visited was during their annual Jimmy Buffet "Parrot Head" weekend. Man was the pool packed! I ended up finding a spot near the large pool, and spend the day enjoying the sun. I even had a nude lunch at the pool side bar, what a great burger! The second visit was 3 days later, on a Wednesday, and what a difference a few days make, there were very few people there on a weekday! I really enjoyed my visit there on this day, even though it did rain a little. I again enjoyed a great burger at the pool side bar. I even met a great couple that one time lived not to far from my office, in fact we did some work in their house while they lived in this area!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place - customer service (except for Cheeks) is very unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Snovakil
Reviews.Content: Rooms (apartment with kitchen), although somewhat outdated, are comfortable. Excellent beds- extremely comfortable. Gary, part time bartender at Cheeks, is very personable and efficient. Great guy! Thank you Gary! Do not expect to have your room cleaned before 3 p.m. When asking front desk at 2 p.m. when room would be done, was told "oh well". Didn't seem to care about customer service at all. Housekeeping showed up at 3.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the flight”
Reviews.Author: grannieOxford
Reviews.Content: We have been travelling to the USA to visit The Cove for 15 years, sometimes twice a year. It is very relaxing and we have made some wonderful friends. The staff are friendly and extremely helpful. Yes the accommodation is a bit dated but I understand this is being addressed. The pools, hot tub and shuffle board courts are favourites.Their special offers are very useful especially if you have non naturist members of the family with you which necessitates staying off site and visiting daily. We will be there again in March 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: gbj67
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week and it wasn't long enough. You only need one change of clothes for your stay (the one your arrived in and the set you will leave in) and in addition to flip-flops or sandals a pair of gym shoes would be practical. If you would like to play tennis that is the only requirement. Safety reasons. You may need more if you wish to do some tourist stuff outside of this resort. The room is really a motel room style but one does not spend much time there. It is clean and spacious with free WiFi connection to the internet. The staff are helpful. The permanent retired residents are friendly and everyone there is polite and considerate. This is gong to be one of my favourite vacation places.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Fun Place to be!”
Reviews.Author: Postman83
Reviews.Content: The accommodations are a bit dated, but they have everything that you could possible need. I might like to see them put a safe in the room and update the locks, but I am sure this on the drawing board and will be taken care of in the near future. “Cheeks” (they’re bar service) serves the best Bar Food that I have ever had. The prices are great and service is with a smile. Prices - if you were to raise them a little I would not be offended. I do not drink alcohol, so I cannot comment on the drinks Lakeside Restaurant was good, but not excellent. Yesterday I asked for a soft boiled egg and received a hardboiled egg (I thought that eggs should include toast, but I paid extra for the toast). I thought that last night’s dinner came out too soon, but the service was very good and it is nice to see all those smiling faces on the staff. Once again I would not complain about the prices, because they are and they throw in entertainment what more could I (we) want? There was far less the audience than there should have been. Oh yes, you could eat in the nude, but most people had some form of clothing on. We had massages. Two and a half years ago Tammy (the owner of the franchise) was going away for a weekend (We thought it would be nice to spend a few extra dollars) and we were excited about being at Cypress Cove so we purchased six massages for the price of five, using four of the six on that vacation. We were very happy that she honored that purchase this weekend. My wife and I both had great massages from Suzanne and Nancy. Nude massages are the only way to go! My wife also had a great manicure and pedicure with Angel. Bottom line - where can you get this much in a resort for $115@ night? Nowhere else and I (we) really do want to thank you for this. I wish that they were in our back yard but unfortunately they are a 1,000 miles away. Finally there 4th of July celebration was very cute, a few fireworks, professionally done and disco for as late as you wanted to stay up. Keep up the good work Cypress Cove!

Reviews.Title: “My room at the cove”
Reviews.Author: Kbeovgieny
Reviews.Content: I have always just been a day member but finally got a chance to stay! The room was great, clean, and in very close proximity to the pool. I look forward to my next chance to not put clothes on when it's late afternoon!

Reviews.Title: “Have Fun In the Sun but Skip the Restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: reachmik
Reviews.Content: Honestly, its a good place. We had one visit and purchased a membership. You don't have to be a member to stay though. But if you live in Central Florida, you just may want to have the member benefits. The whole place is pretty much clothing optional, including the dining areas and bar. The large and very clean pools are the only places where nudity is required. There are families and friendly couples all around. No singles trolling about. That would be out of bounds for this place. There are often parties and dancing on the weekends and lots of special events and opportunities for fun. But there are down sides too. The place is VERY old school. The hotel rooms (they call them villas) are older with 70-ish amities. Good enough to use though and you SHOULD use them. Dining at the Lakeside Restaurant is spotty at best. rarely have I had a good meal there. The cafe at Cheeks by The Pool is better but stick to sandwiches. If you care for drink, they do a good job with that. Still, if you're there for a few days and don't want to get dressed to venture off property, pack some food, spices and drinks and cook yourself. You''ll save money and you'll eat better. This is a laid back resort with sunning and socializing the main activities. My wife & I play tennis on one of the 6 hard courts. Inquire about near by golf, though I don't believe there's a course on property. There is a LOT of nature to see but renting a golf cart is the best way to see it all. You can walk it too if you are a light hiker. Oh and there's a pretty good fitness center & massage. There's a salon and gift shop too but those you'd have to judge for yourself. So bring the sunscreen, bring some food & drink, under-pack and most definitely plan to underdress. Oh Tourists ... I'd plan on three days to 5 days if you're slipping out to a theme park. WDW's not too far away by car. Locals, this is great for a safe, friendly and inexpensive day trip, especially with the kids & just far enough off the beaten path to make it an event. Have fun in the sun!

Reviews.Title: “Great pools, public areas....friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Greg G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend singles gathering. Activities were designed to meet and mingle. Entertainment supplied by resort was great. Restaurants were high quality and reasonably priced. Grounds and facilities are very clean and well maintained. Outside of resort within two miles are major food markets, drug stores and chain restaurants atlhough the restaurants inside are just fine. We had the larger, two room accommodation with kitchen facilities which was fully equiped. This would be great for families or up tp six people if two do not mind sleeping on a pullout sofa and all sharing one bathroom. Our group used many of the showers throughout the resort before swimming or using the two hottubs. The Cove is easy to find, just off a major highway.

Reviews.Title: “Great nudist resort”
Reviews.Author: hunkl
Reviews.Content: As a uk tourist i try to visit here whenever i am in Fla, i mostly come here on a day visit but have stayed in a room here which was ok but quite expensive compared with other hotels in the Kissimmee area. The resort itself is very good situated round a large lake, there are 2 heated pools, lakeside restaurant and bar serving good food. I was here in May and found during the week it was generally quiet but weekends it gets busier with alot more couples and families. Looking forward to my next visit in October

Reviews.Title: “Dynamite visit”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: Cypress Cove provided extra activities that united our group together into a cohesive family. Cypress Cove goes above and beyond what anyone would expect from a resort. It is truly a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: coconut93
Reviews.Content: Our second holiday weekend stay and my wife and I were again pleased. Since it was a very last minute trip, we drove to Orlando and set up a tent by the lake since the rooms were all booked. We enjoy camping anyway so camping by a lake is something we are really used to. We are a couple in our late 30's early 40's(me) and this resort is frequented by many guests our age or younger. The only issue we had this trip was with the volleyball tourney which brought in quite a few young 'non-naturist/nudist' guests. One night my wife walked to the campsite bathroom in the middle of the night nude and felt very uncomfortable when a group of these college aged male guests saw her and made not so polite comments to themselves. Waking up to see that little alligator just hanging out offshore of our campsite was pretty cool! :) We hung out by the pool as usual and had a great time. The resort allows everyone to bring coolers to the pool which is awesome, but we did use the bar a lot as well. The food is great at the restaurant and grill. My wife is a sun worshiper so she loves working on erasing her tan lines away. Everyone we met was friendly as was the staff. Chatting it up with other guests at the hot tubs is always fun. We had a 'couple' massage where she and I got our full body massages together and the service was fantastic! The grounds are still always clean and so are the bathrooms and buildings. Cypress Cove has become our little 'getaway' spot. We cant wait to head back. We are looking at Labor Day weekend for our next trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Retirement Community with Resort Amenities”
Reviews.Author: agilberttx
Reviews.Content: This resort is principally a retirement community, and if it were appropriately named it would be called Cypress Cove Nudist Retirement Community and Resort. We rented an apartment (there are about 80 rental units, ranging from hotel-room style accommodations to apartments with full kitchen) which we found very comfortable and complete, close to the major resort activity sites, and nicely furnished. During our visit we used the services of the massage therapist at the spa, which we found very competent. The two swimming pools (one shallower, one deeper) were crystal-clear and all of the areas were impeccably clean. We only used the restaurant in the pool area, but the food was good and reasonably priced. The gym was very complete and modern, with excellent quality equipment. There is a major supermarket within 2 miles, a small convenience store with limited offerings at the resort, and a 7-11 store with gas station across the road. There are a number of fast-food and sit-down retaurants close by. The location is somewhat remote from the major Orlando attractions (about 15-20 miles) but the roads are excellent. We found that a GPS unit was very helpful. All in all, this is the nicest naturist facility we have ever visited, but during the 5 weekdays we were there the (nude) recreation areas were almost exclusively attended by seniors. On Friday a couple of families arrived, indicating the weekends might have a shift in demographics, however we were off to a Caribbean cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing vacation we have had in years!”
Reviews.Author: flgirl48
Reviews.Content: Our very first nudist experience and we picked the best resort to enjoy it in. From the moment we came through the gate we felt welcomed and totally at ease. The staff is friendly and efficient. The entire resort is beautifully maintained. The other guests and permanent residents we met were so much fun. The food at the restaurant was very good and the wait staff did and excellant job. Took advantage of the massage service and "WOW", just made the trip better. Can't say enough good things about this place. We will definately be back! Special shout out to Angel in the salon. She was so sweet and made my hair look great for dinner/dancing and the Redneck costume contest.

Reviews.Title: “First time visit ...won't be the last.”
Reviews.Author: LisaR29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are new to the whole nudist thing (in public) and found this to be a fantastic place. Everyone was so welcoming and you couldn't ask for better staff. We were welcomed on the newbie tour with fun shouts and coudn't wait to get involved. Thank you thank you thank you...We are already reserved for the 4th of July weekend. Can't wait... by the way, there are plenty of chaise lounges and chairs for everyone.. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Just like coming home”
Reviews.Author: joe_kansas_2012
Reviews.Content: The resort continues to get better and better and has the most friendly and courteous staff of any resort (nudist or textile) in Florida. The facilities are world class. Without a doubt, the best place to stay in Central Florida. The only downside of Cypress Cove is having to leave at the end of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could be a nice place but not consumer friendly”
Reviews.Author: dexter6969
Reviews.Content: Made reservations as a first time visitor and got an extra night free. The room was OK even without a microwave. The grounds were clean and the resort overall was fairly quiet. Too quiet in some respects. The music was so muted in the "social" pool that even seated under the speaker, one could hardly hear it. Asking for the music to be turned up to acceptable levels resulted in a small increase then complaints from the old-timers. Speaking of old-timers, they apparently rule the roost there and get their way even to the detriment of the resort's business. To top it off, there was a pool gestapo that would gather your towels from your seats if you were gone for more than an hour and just pile them all up over to the side. She was unfriendly, obviously very taken with her power over the pool. The resort has great possibilities, but needs to reevaluate its practices to keep the business. BTW: hardly any night life to speak of...

Reviews.Title: “Nice nudist resort with a few misgivings”
Reviews.Author: CharlestonTwoOfUs
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Cypress Cove. We have been to many nudist resorts including Desert Sun in Palm Springs , Paradise Lakes near Tampa, as well as clothing optional inns in Key West. So we are definitely not newbies to nudist resorts. The resort itself is terrific. The rooms are large and clean, the grounds are quiet at night so sleeping was peaceful. The food at the two restaurants were great. We did a thorough search of the local area before checking in looking for restaurants when we arrived. Essentially there are none. In fact there is nothing but residental areas around Cypress Cove. So you are pretty much stuck with the pool bar for lunch and the lake restaurant for dinner. Not a problem. The food was very good and very reasonably priced at both. As is the case at all nudist resorts the atmosphere is casual and the people are very friendly. However, like all nudist resorts the majority of people are locals or frequent weekend visitors that all know each other so you will experience the continual reminder that "you are from out of town" vibe. Another good thing is unlike a few resorts there is no "swinger" element at Cypress Cove. It is frowned upon and discouraged. So if "mixing it up" is your thing, this ain't the place. We will definitely come back here. It was relaxing, reasonably priced and friendly. Our things is to hang by the pool and relax. However, if you are looking for a central location with lots of everything nearby, this is not your place.

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing resort with ture Nudist Values.”
Reviews.Author: slw1541
Reviews.Content: Great place to catch the sun or shade. Have been visiting "The Cove" for over 20 years. The restaurant served delicious food. The whole staff is friendly and helpful. This is a place where singles,couple and families can feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Only getting better”
Reviews.Author: CheriDonna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at the beach at this resort a bit over 17 years ago. It has only gotten better. The staff, the amenities, just about everything is great.

Reviews.Title: “Well done”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveler2000
Reviews.Content: Pleasant place and nice people. We were total strangers and did me some friendly cpls. Dinner/dancing was different.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and fun weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Clampy16
Reviews.Content: We where in a party of 30 people from a Tampa nudist resort and had a relaxing fun filled weekend, great entertainment great food friendly folks, and no bad behaviour that we see at the big resort in Land O Lakes. The grounds are always spotless and the staff are always helpfull. We are already planning our next trip and can not wait.

Reviews.Title: “Total relaxation in a safe, friendly and enjoyable atmoshere.”
Reviews.Author: TheMontaukmonster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have visited a few nudist resorts and a couple of nude beaches. We do this only once or maybe twice a year. This was our first time at Cypress Cove and are definitly going back. The facility is run well and the staff very helpful. There were always plenty of lounges available in both pool areas. Our room was neat and clean and the new flat screen TV had premium cable. The pool bar was reasonablely priced for drinks and snacks. The full service restaurant was excellent in quality and price. We both had the fish and chips, huge portion. By the last day of our stay my wife felt very comfortable and we both hated to leave. It was so hot the last afternoon we spent hours in in pool just staying cool and relaxing. I can only describe Cypress Cove as the Gold Standard for nudist resorts in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the best of its kind on the east coast”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNFla
Reviews.Content: We have been to several (probably most) clothing optional (or nudist) resorts in Florida and each has its strengths and weaknesses. Overall, Cypress Cove was the best, or at least very good, in every category, although we realize it's a subjective measurement. We were expecting it to be less friendly than it proved to be, based upon some other reviews regarding overly prudish or judgemental permanent residents. For example, we joked about not even being able to hold hands (PDA) near the pool area, based upon some previous reviews. We are fairly open-minded and have visited some strictly adult and pretty wild sites, and are live and let live unless people are pushy or arrogant. On the other hand, we're not real keen on lots of noisy kids running around. Cypress Cove tended to be a nice balance. Mostly a middle-aged, married crowd, no obvious swingers. Very scenic, reasonably priced, friendly staff (very important to us), and a nice Saturday night dance atmosphere (also high on our list of desires) in the bar & grill area. No swinging or wildly sexy attire, but reasonably sexy and intimate, like an average dance bar where the people would be clothed. We enjoy a good dance atmosphere, so that was a big plus for us. Most of the crowd was middle aged and friendly. There were a couple of younger (20 something) couples also. Not too prudish, not too lewd. Nice breakfast in the restaurant overlooking the lake. We will probably return. The rooms appeared to be better kept than most of the other nudist places we've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Travellarma
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself are normally beach people but CC provided all of our needs in a great atmosphere wonderfull staff and good location. We have been twice and are re/booked for a month next Mar.2012 and Feb. 2013 to tie in with the BN nude cruise package they provide.

Reviews.Title: “Quit, old, peacefull”
Reviews.Author: 188590Paul
Reviews.Content: My family and I are not new to naturist campgrounds or hotels, but I had never been to one in the USA. What a huge difference to Europe! First of all they call it a "nudist" resort instead of using the in my view friendlier word "naturist", but then who cares... The average age is very high in this resort though, I bet you it was close to 70 if not above. Part of this is simply Florida, part is indeed the whole idea of naturism I was told. I dare to say that naturism is much more something of all ages in Europe. The fact that also the restaurant was fully in the bare (by choice of most, was not compulsary) was a bit too much for me. People were friendly allright, but again compared to Europe I believe it is easier to connect in France, Croatia, Spain but also Jamaica or Mexico for that matter with fellow guests than it was in this resort. Could be the age difference too... The lake was beautiful, loved to see the small aligators swimming so close by. The rooms and everything else was old and outdated, and could use a great deal of investment to beef it up compared to non-US (France, Spain, Croatia, Jamaica, Mexico) standards I have grown accustomed to. Certainly at the USD 146 per night I paid for a room they should be able to reserve some money for upgrading. The place was nicely occupied, which was partly due to Spring brake of course. Staff were very friendly indeed. The food was OK, the pool area and services offered good and pleasant. Internet worked fine everywhere. Overall, bit above average rating from my end here. Still, thanks staff of the Cove for your kind services, and I wish you well...!

Reviews.Title: “Dated room”
Reviews.Author: Nude_Tube
Reviews.Content: An average place to stay. This is a nudist resort and the vast majority of the residents are in campers. Most are older than 60.

Reviews.Title: “Always a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sunnycpl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 8 nights in March, and again, we had a wonderful time. The pool temp was just perfect, the weather great except for one day of rain, and the staff was very accommodating. Had breakfast in the restaurant 3 times, and had leftovers twice from that experience. Lunch at Cheeks Bar was great and so was the food and service. Also had dinner there once, as well as at the restaurant. We love play Trivial Pursuit and Bingo and did so with friends that live on the property twice. Lots of fun and the entertainment in the restaurant we good too. All in all, you can't beat the price for what you receive as it's a great bargain. This was our 5th trip and we'll be back again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “MORE RULES AND MORE RULES AND MORE RULES.”
Reviews.Author: chuckiemon
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Cypress Cove since 1980. Been a full member since '07. In the past, the highlight of my stay at "The Cove" has been the enjoyment of laying in a chase lounge by the pool and enjoying a good cigar while reading a book. Now, according to the signs, "NO CIGARS PLEASE", cigars are prohibited. What happened? Did one person complain? Is cigar smoke more offensive than cigarette smoke? Seems to me there could be one small designated area for cigar smoking somewhere in the pool area where no one would be OFFENDED by cigar smoke. Further, wife and I went out of our room, to the pool at 9:45am on Sat, 3/19. We were just lucky enough to find the last available table/chairs under the pavilion between the two pools. With the good weather what it was, I expected a big crowd. However, of all the lounge chairs / tables that were "staked out", there were very few people actually there by the pool. One must assume that people come out early in the morning, stake out some land by the pool and then go back to bed and show up later on at their leisure. I don't think this is right. In my opinion, if you are going to claim a spot, you should be in it or in the pool or Cheeks, etc, not back at your camper/ hotel room, etc. (I would write the following in the block below but you don't give me enough space) - I am 62 y.o. and hve been a practicing social nudist since 1973. With every passing year, the average age of the general membership at nudist clubs/resorts appears to get older. I know this is a topic of discussion among the AANR. Not too many years ago, Cypress Cove built the covered childrens play area with things for kids to play on, etc. This was a good idea and an attempt to attract yoiunger families I am sure. Why not a kiddie pool?? Kids at the pool want to go in the pool, not climb the jungle jim when its 90+ degrees out. Pine Tree in MD has a kiddie pool right next to the outdoor pool and it is usually a very busy attraction in the summer. Just a thought.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Nudist Trailer Park Caters to Residents”
Reviews.Author: richard1534
Reviews.Content: Residents grouped and were unfriendly. Most "Hellos" were ignored. Restaurant continues to be biggest problem. At least open for Breakfast but Dinner Reserved for trailer parkees. While we knew Sat St Pat would require Reservations. Never thought Monday would be problem, especially at 5PM. no warning of Toga Party with almost all tables reserved for Trailer Parkees. People in Hotel Rooms NEED restaurant. I long for old Lake Como where Meals were Included Now Parkees come for some"Special Nights" and expect restaurant to be there. Facilities-again overwhelmed by residents. By 9AM Sat they had"reserved" ALL Chaises at New pool. They come early and clip towels on everything Just Not A Resort. Besides Breakfast ,Dinners were DISGUSTING Wait Staff friendly and efficient but Food is BAD Rooms-Spotless and in Good condition Considering one is a Second class visitor, Prices are Too high!

Reviews.Title: “The Clothing Optional Experience Has A Price.”
Reviews.Author: iluvtnb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cypress Cove for the first time, having visited there before. For the same price as a resort on the beach, where everything was beautifully maintained, we stayed at Cypress Cove, where everything wasn't. The staff were pleasant, and the food was good, both at Cheeks, and at the Lakeside Inn, not gourmet, but solid American cuisine. The clothing optional experience was freeing and delightful. The people were friendly and the atmosphere quiet and restful. Our room was old and basically refurbished. We had no outdoor sitting area, even though we were in a ground room floor. When we asked for a different room, we were told that any change would cost more and be an upgrade, from the $165.00 we were already spending. The room was clean, but the air conditioning did not work well, even though it was March. The room was stuffy all night, and while we reported the problem, there was no follow up call or contact to demonstrate any concern that the room was uncomfortable. Throughout the resort, there is a sense of things not being well maintained, little things, that still made a difference. Sidewalks not cleaned of debris. The fountain at the pool was dirty and not functioning. The pool area had a dated look. If a CO resort is a new experience, or if the quality of the room is a minor thing for you, then Cypress Cove, is a great place to stay. We might stay there again, but would go with lowered expectations, and probably look for other alternatives, given the price for what we received

Reviews.Title: “The best nudist resort in America”
Reviews.Author: TropicalPhoto
Reviews.Content: I first visited Cypress Cove in 1992. Over the years I have seen improvements time after time, including a gorgeous new swimming pool, surrounded by a massage studio, fitness center, boutique, game room, and playground. Rounding out the poolside features, Cheeks Bar is an easy-going place for drinks and great food. For tent campers, the spacious sites along the lake front offer a breathtaking view of the sunrise over the lake, filtered through the moss covered trees. adjoining the lake is the Lakeside Restaurant and Scuttlebutts Bar, with a large deck overlooking the beach, ideal for a relaxing breakfast or coffee.. Paddle boats and canoes are free for use on the lake and golf cart rentals are available to move around the 300 acre property and there are tennis courts for the more acitive guests. The major activity though, is taking advantage of the large sunning areas, pools, and hot tubs and totally relaxing. The resort is now under the management of the third generation of the founding family, with a fourth generation growing up there. My children & now grandchildren enjoy visiting there with me. It's a great place to stay with your family while visiting all the attractions of the central Florida area.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and fun”
Reviews.Author: MkeCpl
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our three day, three night stay at Cypress Cove. We had a Villa Parlor room, which was roomy and comfortable, even if rather outdated in decor and amenities (late 1980's style, small TV and an ancient bedside clock-radio). But we weren't at the resort for the indoors accommodations, and spent as much time as possible in the beautiful weather enjoying the well-manicured grounds and clean, refreshing pools and liberating, clothes-free social atmosphere. The resort has two very nice pools surrounded by plenty of chaise-lounges, a roomy hot tub, an amazingly well-equipped exercise room, a spa, massage therapists, a spacious gift and souvenir shop (which we wished had been open a little later in the day), a large and beautiful lake with free canoeing and paddle boats (and a few alligators), an excellent fine-dining restaurant as well as a less formal poolside bar with a hearty menu, loads of cute little lizards and friendly squirrels, and helpful and pleasant staff ready to assist you. There's even a fun little 9 hole 3-par golf course, where one can swing a club without the encumbrance of flashy golf clothes. And don't trouble yourself to bring your clubs - there are plenty available for your use. We'd recommend Cypress Cove to anyone either experienced in naturist living (such as ourselves), or to those curious to try it out for the first time. The guests and staff are completely respectful and respectable, and you'll definitely enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “best place to relax... nude”
Reviews.Author: katzz1
Reviews.Content: thiis is one of our many visits here. the winter has been brutal for my psyche, an my body.. i told my husband i NEEDED to go lay in the sun, and feel it on my naked back. we are nudists. yes. we spent 6 glorious days in the sun, and needless to say.. i am DARK., especially being blackfoot indian. the staff is very friendly and we always meet great people there. the food and drinks are above par too. we got a 2 week pass for both of us and that was a real plus. it is good... thanks again gor a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great nudist fun for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: velvetkitty19
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. Stopped in after the Discovery shuttle launch and spent the night. Only smoking room was available, we could tell as soon as we walked in but smell did eventually dissipate. Spent time at the bar met friendly folks and had some laughs. (It's hard to be snooty when you're bareass nekkid!). Breakfast in AM was good. Eggs Benedict excellent tangy Hollandaise sauce. Took a while to get our change though. Cash can be so inconvenient sometimes! A few hours by the pool met more nice folks including a family with 2 well-behaved young boys. Pool is strictly nude except for swim diapers. No suits allowed! Great way to spend a Friday.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: SeaTurtle143
Reviews.Content: We were impressed wtih the Restaurant and Pool Bar....both were very nice with good food and price. Cheeks sports bar could use some new, high def TV's, but other than that, it was a nice, fun bar. The other facilities were well maintained, along with the pools and hot tubs. We like to run and found the perimeter road to be very nice. The homes were well maintained and landscaped. I only wised I lived there in the winter. We will be back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place”
Reviews.Author: lifeisaj0urney
Reviews.Content: Really nice feel here, we LOVED it! Some of the residents a little prudish, not as welcome by them but the staff and resort were top notch, will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing winter get away”
Reviews.Author: puresalesman
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived to the end of my stay all the staff were top notch in service. Beautiful pools, hot tub and great food at the restaurants. Waking up each morning naked and being able to go for a walk, stop to eat and then lay in sun it just does not get much better for a nudist. Took a few days to get people to warm up to me, not sure if it was the single (married) male or just being new. Once I was able to make some connections my time was much more enjoyable. It was nice to see all the people enjoying life and relaxed as nudists. I would recommend new beds as mine was very poor to sleep on. I would also recommend that when there is open space in the Vila try to give space between renters, my neighbors were very loud. I would return again and recommend this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Natural relaxation in a convenient and friendly setting”
Reviews.Author: Sonadora89
Reviews.Content: Although there is no beach around for miles (that would make Cypress near-perfect), the well-kept grounds, relaxed atmosphere and, especially the all-nude ambiance make this a very pleasant stay. Lots of couples, mostly middle-aged, but all generations represented and many families. The food is good and reasonably priced, staff is pleasant and the pool areas are ample and well-maintained. Insects sometimes become a bit of a nuisance, but only minor.

Reviews.Title: “An admirable naturist resort”
Reviews.Author: boafm
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 weeks with my spouse at Cypress Cove, after having tested it out for a week in Nov.2010. We had a villa location, that was clean, spacious and agreeable to live in. Swimming pools and surrounding showers are extremely clean, and overall ambiance is family style. No sleazy or disagreable behaviour. The Brown Lake is a pleasure to paddle through (this lake makes the resort fantastic!); several paddle boats wold need a little overhaul. Location at Kissimee is excellent for day trips to the surrounding state parks or Orlando resorts

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to stay in area for Business or Pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: JJandDW
Reviews.Content: After our convention in the area, my husband and I (co-owners of our business) stayed for 5 relaxing and pleasurable days! I was able to work on line while there and enjoy the friendly staff and visitors/residents. The food was so much better than we've had at most other resorts...we were very pleased! I cannot recommend this place highly enough! JJ and DW

Reviews.Title: “Our Winter Home”
Reviews.Author: hwestcott
Reviews.Content: For the past 20 years, The Cove has been our winter home from Nov. to May. The first 15 were in the RV section where we made many friends, enjoying the comeradarie. Now we are in the resident section in a nice home among even more good friends. The Cove is the finest nudist/clothes optional resort in the Northern Hemiphere with its natural enviroment interracting with tasteful infrastructure. Whether we canoe on the 55 acre lake or enjoy a delicious three-course meal at the Lakeside restaurant, we feel welcome, appreciated and at home. Come enjoy the ambiance, friendly folks and the freedom to "come as you are."

Reviews.Title: “An Annual Favorite”
Reviews.Author: WetDiverMiami
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull experience! I've been going to Cypress Cove for 6 or 7 years now. Started with day tips, then camping and now using the hotel. Everyting is in top condition, the staff are excelent and the grounds are spotlessly clean. Can' wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “November vacation at the Cove”
Reviews.Author: Condor449
Reviews.Content: After 12 hours of dirving we were met with a pleasant check in at the office. In the following days we experienced a wonderful stay with good food, friendly staff and a nice room. We stayed several days then broke the stay for a few days in Key West. Comming back from Key West we were again greeted in with a warm welcome. This is a very relaxing and refreshing place to break the stresses of work and cool fall weather. We are plan more weeks here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “So relaxing & peaceful!!!”
Reviews.Author: StormErotica
Reviews.Content: My husband & I returned to Cypress Cove after having such a relaxing & wonderful time with our biker group (Bare Buns Bikers) for the first time, and once again....our stay gave us just what we wanted....a well needed rest, and another relaxing & peaceful stay in a wonderful resort. Our room was spotless, the amenities were all that we required and more, and since it was the Halloween holiday, we had fun, and came home with a special treat....a ribbon for the "Scariest Couple"...we are newlyweds, so we went as "Gouleeweds" and had more fun than we have ever had together. All in all, and although it is a 2 hour drive for us to the resort, Cypress Cove is one of our "Featured" vacation spots, and will remain so for a long time to come. We look forward to sharing our experience with other friends in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GenieOB
Reviews.Content: I have gone to Cypress Cove, and have been a member there for 30 years. It offers a delightful environment, a secluded atmosphere and a diverse community of people. If I travel anywhere near Kissimmee, I make sure I visit and stay at the Cove. Do yourself a favor, treat yourself to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Party time”
Reviews.Author: Eterrell777
Reviews.Content: We had a blast with our friends at karaoke and spending time by the pool. The staff makes you feel so welcom. It was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most relaxing places we've ever been.”
Reviews.Author: Dennis012
Reviews.Content: We stayed at their campground and it is top shelf. Nicely paved roads, grass and landscaping abound. Campsites are large and trees make for a great shady place to sit, have a drink, read a book, go for a walk and relax with friends. As usual, campground people are always the friendliest people in the world and the main reason why we camp and choose to go here.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wondeful day at cypress cove!”
Reviews.Author: nmiller73
Reviews.Content: My wife and i went to cypress cove for the first time and had a very relaxed and enjoyable time. We arrived on a Sunday and only planned to stay for the day. This was our first exerience at a clothing optional resort so we were a little apprehensive but excited at the same time. The main entrance is located across the street from "Lowes" , I mention that because it would have helped us immensely driving down the street looking for the gate. The front gate guard was very friendly and asked for drivers licences & licence plate number. I did not think it unusual and it didn't take long to be on our way inside. We stopped at the front desk and the lady was very helpful signing us in(just a couple small items to read over and sign). After that she took us on a nice tour of the facility and wished us a nice day. I was thinking something was missing and remembered we had not paid yet for our day, so I pulled out my credit card and she said not to worry that our first visit was free. this immediately got us started on a happy note and i thanked her and promised to enjoy some food in their restaurant. we had read many reviews about cypress on here and decided to follow the advice of other trip advisor people to start our day by the lake. The lake is BEAUTIFUL! It wasn't long and we were au natural enjoying a beuatiful Florida day. The whole feeling by the lake was peaceful, there were only one or two other poepl and most were reading. One man, did spend some time staring at my wife but I kind of like that so it didn't bother me(or her, lol)i assumed he was a single male in search of fun, but he did not approach us or say anything rude. The paddle boats looked fun but we were told there were alligators in the lake so we passed(maybe next time we won't be so chicken. I personally WOULD NOT recommend swimming in the lake after having lived in Florida for several years, alligators can strike without warning. Anyways, we strolled over the the cafe by the pool(cheeks) and had an awesome lunch. No complaints. There other rstaurant by the lake was closed but the food we ate was wonderful. We were anxious to try out the pools so we headed to the one closest us(the smaller one). Seemed to be a local crowd but no one was unkind. Maybe a few looks, but nothing bad. The atmosphere was very relaxed, again, with many people reading. We enjoyed ourselves, truthfully we wanted to cuddle more(no not sex, just cuddle) but we had read where other trip advisor members had been chastised for being too cozy so we refrained, still enjoyed the pool immensely. We followed that with a dip in the hot tub(huge) and had it all to ourselves(daytime). We then went to the much larger pool and loved it even more. It had a nice waterfall flowing inot the pool and the crown seemed a little more active and playful. Just a note, the majoiryt of the crowd seemed to be in the 50-60 range(we are in our 30's) but we did see about 4-5 couples inour age group and had a very nice chat with one, no pressure, just good conversation. We hopped out and tried the other jacuzzi near this pool, a little smaller but loved the feel of a breeze while sitting in it. Again, we had it all to ourselves. Then we took another stroll by the lake, toured the game room(wonderful photos on the wall) and relaxed a bit before one final dip in the pool. The pool with the waterfall was by far our favorite. Although we are not 100% sure it did feel at times we were being watched by one our two regulars to make sure we did not engage in any sexual activities. While i understand their desire to keep the club NUDIST and not SWINGER my wife and I enjoy light cuddling and had to hold back a bit out of respect i guess. All in all we had a very nice RELAXING time and will definitely be back. If you're a first time couple i think you will like this place a lot, if you get excited though you may have to care for each other in your room(we just stayed for the day so we can't comment. ) My wife and i joked about the older crowd just being a bit jealous since us youngsters didn't have to buy little blue pills just yet, lol. all in all a great day!

Reviews.Title: “Great first time experience!!”
Reviews.Author: mkr2327
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience at a clothing optional resort. We already had a trip planned in October and found out the we were going to be in the area so we decided to spend the night at Cypress Cove to check it out and see if it was for us or if we needed to cancel and go to Disney. We arrived around 9:30 so it was already dark which may have made our first time a bit easier but it seemed like once we took our clothes off and walked out the door we were pro's! We went to Cheek's and had a light dinner and then swam in the pool and checked out the hot tub - it was wonderful!! It was just as easy the next morning when it was day light. Everyone was very nice and says hello but it was like we were in our own little world. I thought I might be uncomfortable if there were children around and the funny thing is we were eating breakfast in the restuarant and a family came in with 3 kids (all clothed) and I didn't even think about it. I was so relaxed and so comfortable I didn't even think about not having clothes on. It was a wonderful stay we haven't been that relaxed in a long time and we hated to leave. We definitely can't wait to go back in two weeks when we can stay longer and we defintely won't be going to Disney!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wedding Night To Remember!”
Reviews.Author: littlelou0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for our wedding night and I have never been more chuffed with a resort. We checked in quite late in the day and were made to feel very welcome right from the word go. Our villa was immaculate and I was bowled over by the excellent facilities. We even had a basket of goodies on arrival and this I thought was a great touch. The choice of leisure facilities was great. There are 2 huge pools and also a gym, spa, whirlpool, jacuzzi and even tennis courts. There are 2 restaurants on site offering everything from a snack to a 3 course dinner and were very reasonably priced too. All the staff are very friendly and made us feel very welcome. We will definately be going back to this resort as 1 night is definately not enough!

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful 3 night getaway!”
Reviews.Author: kittenallen
Reviews.Content: We love CYPRESS COVE. It's not the 4-star by any stretch, but the relaxation of going nude and not having worries of whose looking or critiquing is so wonderful, we'll go back again and again. The food is terrific in both Cheeks and the Lakeside. We recommend this resort to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: nu33
Reviews.Content: Cypress Cove is a beautiful resort that my wife and I cannot get enough of. It's set on a large lake, has two swimming pools, tennis courts, hot tubs and other excellent amenities. The hotel rooms are dated but clean. On weekends they have dances sometimes with live music. We were there for the jazz weekend in April which featured very good jazz groups friday and saturday. I'm not a big fan of DJs but we've enjoyed dances at the pool bar particularly those featuring DJ Xavier. The entertainment director, Regis , is doing a good job trying to make the resort a more contemporary without chasing away the older guests. The food at the Lakeside Restaurant is ok, but can't be beat considering the dress code. The best food is on Sundays when they serve great barbecue. The room rates are a bit pricey, but are probably in line with other naturist facilities. Pricing at the onsite convenient store in the office is reasonable and they have a reasonable late check out policy. Over all Cypress Cove is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Always Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sgt_33
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Cove numerous times. It has always been great but now it is even better with the parlor studio suites. The restaurant and lounge (Cheeks) always serve the best food at fantastic prices. Two awesome pools and the friendliest staff add to it not to mention it's close proximity to Diisneyworld, Universal and Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday”
Reviews.Author: suntanfan91
Reviews.Content: After we mentioned we were celebrating a birthday, the ever gracious staff truly impressed us with their generous hospitality and ammenities. It was the best birthday and a great, relaxing, and entertaining weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The Best People are at the Cove!”
Reviews.Author: Robin009
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Cove for many years..Just when you think it can't get any better than this it does. The staff and management are the best and you can always expect a super clean comfortable villa at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Cypress Cove is the best family naturist resort in Florida”
Reviews.Author: berlinrahjah
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Safe gated resort. Food is good but a larger selection would be better. The rooms are comfortable but the mattress are getting a little old. The pools are great and safe for the whole family. The lake beach could be a little cleaner, needs to be raked. The community residents are very friendly. Just what a vacation should be.

Reviews.Title: “The best for the money”
Reviews.Author: Nuderuby
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to kick back relax, or kick up your heels!! Clean, comfortable rooms and activities galore.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for an ultimate relaxing weekend.”
Reviews.Author: DaveFromJacksonville
Reviews.Content: Cypress Cove is my favorite destination in Florida because I can be completely at rest. The hot tubs are excellent as well as the pools, right next the the night club. The Cove also has a gift shop, food store, workout room, massage, and hair salon. The lakeside restaurant has an upscale menu that is fairly inexpensive. The breakfast buffets are FABULOUS Cypress Cove is the best place to visit to find out what the clothing optional lifestyle is about because it is a clothing-optional resort. You won't get pressured to get neked.. The only place where clothes are not welcomed at the Cove is in the pool. (This is policy at just about all clothing optional places)

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation you will evet have!”
Reviews.Author: love_fl71
Reviews.Content: We never thought about being naked in public till a few years ago. We went to Cypress cove and where blown away. It is nicer then most other camping resorts and theb people are very friendly. It is also very cost effective. You can even take the slow road to being nude. Stay by the beach and wear a bathing suit till you are comfortable. What a great family or couples vacation. It we lived closer we would b e there every weekend. Keep up the good work guys.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get better than this”
Reviews.Author: azwild
Reviews.Content: I cannot come to Florida without a visit to Cypress Cove. It is one of the best in the nation, if not the world -- a world class resort for the traveling nudist. From an Arizonan

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Experience”
Reviews.Author: ClassyGal8
Reviews.Content: We go to Cypress Cove several times a year with our family. The "Family Fest" weekends are the best complete with games, crafts and all kinds of activities for families. The "Family Olympics" is the best! We love how they cater to the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Herc407
Reviews.Content: I've vacationed at Cypress Cove for over 25 years, and watched this always lovely resort continue to get better and better. The Cove features beautiful, well-manicured grounds and has, in recent years, upgraded its weekend activities. The atmosphere is still more sedate than its ultra-upscale Tampa competitors, but depending on one's tastes that's not a bad thing. The Cypress Cove staff is mostly pleasant and helpful, though on a few occasions I've received decidedly perfunctory replies to inquiries. The fitness center is well-equipped and, for an additional fee, provides a nice change from sunbathing, soaking, and other indolent activities. I concur with the highly positive reviews posted here, so instead I would like to address two areas of criticism submitted by others: the resort's singles policy and unfriendliness of residents. I've stayed at the Cove both with my wife and now as a widower. I can't speak for management, but my impression is that Cypress Cove, like most nudist resorts and camps, considers the admittance of any particular single male to be a judgment call, especially if the visitor is not a member of the AANR or Naturist Society. The Cove has always been family/couples oriented, period. True, the resort sponsors "Singles Weekends," but I suspect one goal is to encourage male and female guests to later return with a partner. A pleasant, friendly demeanor when arranging for a visit can go a long way toward creating a favorable impression. If you're an unfamiliar single male, just showing up at the gate is never a good idea. The folks who live all or part of the year at Cypress Cove tend to be cliquish, and some are resentful of vacationers and weekend visitors. They seem to forget without that source of income the resort would be hard-pressed to to provide the first-class facility they enjoy. Whether a single person or a couple, being friendly (but not pushy) and helpful (should the opportunity arise), can make striking up a conversation much easier. Since the turnover of new faces is constant, the onus to make new acquaintances is on visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and relaxing for a great value.”
Reviews.Author: raysplace
Reviews.Content: we were lucky to obtain a week in March since The Cove is usually booked up. We could not wait for our week to arrive. When we arrived we were greeted with smiles. The first thing we did was head to the heated pool. The pool was clean, warm and had numerous friendly faces. I was really impressed with the lift at the pool for the handicapped and showers everywhere. Wife and I were able to maintain our workout routine at their gym which was pleasant, clean and not very busy. The meals at the restaurant were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: phrog1975
Reviews.Content: The rooms are newly refurbished. The handicapped room has a roll-in shower (no ledge to step over). The sofa bed was very comfortable, also. We made great use of the kitchen facilities in our apartment. Both pools were very clean and chemically correct, as were the hot tubs.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with alot of activities, many amenities, and wonderful setting.”
Reviews.Author: tammymcg2
Reviews.Content: Great place....alot of activities or just a great place to relax. Very comfortable atmosphere and everyone is pleasant and makes you feel welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RESORT”
Reviews.Author: dt2018
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Cypree Cove several times and it is the nice nudist resort we have ever been to. My wife - who took her time driving into skinny dipping - says it is definitely her favorite and will go there at the drop on a hat ( and more). The grounds are delightful and as a 25 year veteran of the restaurant business - I can say the food at both restaurants exceed expectations. My only negative comment is - no water volleyball. if you are interested in trying a clothing optional vacation - this is a great place to start.

Reviews.Title: “Cypress Cove -- a wonderful and relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: jp34447
Reviews.Content: We are in our fourth year as members at Cypress Cove and thoroughly enjoy all ammenities offered by the Cove. We have been to other Nudist Resorts, but found none can compare to the Cove. The entire staff is very professional and personable in every aspect of their position. We normally stay in a Villa Apartment room and the accomodations are always very clean and spacious. The family values of the Cove are also a very big plus during each stay. Whether it be your first nudist experience or you want to have a very relaxing stay at a premier nudist resort, I highly recommend Cypress Cove.

Reviews.Title: “Simply, the best!”
Reviews.Author: Melisi70
Reviews.Content: Cypress Cove is simply the best Florida has to offer. The resort/hotel is nothing short of beautiful, and the staff are the nicest and friendliest people in the service industry. I have been frequenting this resort for more than a decade now, and i have never stayed anywhere else while vacationing in Florida. Over the years i have introduced many friends and family members to the resort (first-timers), and all have expressed interest in coming back again and again. Cypress Cove is in a league if its own. If you're looking for a class - A vacation resort, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Low key and lovely”
Reviews.Author: jshopiro
Reviews.Content: Cypress Cove is a great family-style nudist resort that keeps improving every year. There are plenty of activities and entertainment but also opportunity to relax or socialize with nude friends new or old. Good food in the restaurant and bar, massage by the pool, a nice hair salon, and a boutique (clothing for nudists?) complement the pools and spas. Includes RV spaces and homes for longer stays. Prices are very reasonable. A great choice for the long-time nudist or the newbie.

Reviews.Title: “Our Personal Place of Choice in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: traveltree52053
Reviews.Content: Gated community with well coordinated entry attendent. Easy check in area is staffed overnight with small convenience mart in same area. Rooms are not fancy but are clean and comfortable, some kitchen suites which are nominally priced and well worth it for the extra room. This is a nude facility. My wife and I have stayed in many clothing optional faciliies and acknowledge Cypress Cove as one of our favorites because of the attactive well maintained and spacious grounds. Tennis, Lake with canoes, Bocci Ball, Vollyball courts all available, the fitness facility has been an extra charge in the past. Two great swimming pools and a bar restaurant area and the usual nudist hot tubs. Excellent restaurant with nice dance floor and good music once or twice a week. And in the past there has been a morning fitness group a couple time a week. The staff, the permanent residents, and the day use members are appropriately friendly, helpful, we always feel comfortable and secure. So even if we are in Orlando on business in a Five Star Hotel when done we make a Bee Line for Cypress Cove ASAP. There is nothing we find not to like although we might request a Juke Box at the restaurant dance floor for the nights the is not music. There is a Juke Box in the Pool Bar and Grill but its not a good area to dance. .

Reviews.Title: “What a relaxing and fun resort.”
Reviews.Author: elh3269
Reviews.Content: Great room location overlooking the pool. Central to all parts of the park. Clean, simple and quiet. The beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return feels like a second home!”
Reviews.Author: DavidASt_Catharines
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made our first visit to the Cove back in November, it was our first naturist experience. We took advantage of the three month trial offer, it was a great deal and gave us the flexibility to come and go as we desired. We live in Florida during the winter months and found Cypress Cove a fantastic place to relax and get a great tan. Everyone at the Cove was wonderful. The nicest experience for my wife and I were the friends we made and continue to stay in contact with, we look forward to meeting them this coming winter. Hopefully we have a warmer winter in 2011. We recently spent a day at a local naturist resort I won't mention the name of it but we certainly appreciated Cypress Cove that much more, we felt fortunate to be members at such a wonderful resort. There is a lot to be said about the naturist life style and the true relaxation you experience, it's hard to explain but I would encourage anyone even slightly intrigued to give it a try. Maybe well see you at the Cove this winter, it's an amazing place to chill.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly atmosphere for single guy nudist.”
Reviews.Author: shogunSanAntonio
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single apartment-style room for three nights and had a great time. The workout facilities were top notch; comparable to the nicest hotels for a fraction of the price ($20 for the my entire stay). The restaurant on the lake had an awesome seafood buffet and a very friendly wait staff and hostess. I am a married nudist, but happened to be traveling alone on this vacation. I never felt anything but genuine hospitality from both the employees and the guests. I'm a 40 year old man and was there for the nudist lifestyle and Cypress Cove was a perfect retreat for me. The only thing I think they could do better is to open the AANR library more frequently. I was looking forward to seeing this massive nudist archive but it wasn't open at all during my entire trip. I'll have to wait till next time which I'm sure will happen within the year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Suntraveler4321
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Cypress Cove several times, both as a single and with a partner. I have had a great time every time I have visited. Two pools and two hot tubs, tennis, paddle boats on the lake, exercise room and many other fun things to do. Food, drinks and entertainment all at your finger tips. Located close to Disney and the other attractions. If you have always wanted to try a nude vacation, than Cypress Cove is the best place for you first visit. I will be looking forward to visiting this resort again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait till we have an open weekend”
Reviews.Author: Mrutenberg
Reviews.Content: We love staying there, The pool parties, the great food & staff at Cheeks.. Where else can you relax and have fun like this..

Reviews.Title: “You can stay busy or relax by the pools. Perfect vacation.”
Reviews.Author: klinsen
Reviews.Content: There is something to do all the time. Tennis, swimming, golf, just to name a few. Exercise in classes or go to the fabulous gym. Loved the resort and the people.

Reviews.Title: “For many nudists, the perfect place.”
Reviews.Author: NudistCamper
Reviews.Content: The only rule I don't Like is the rule about pool floats. Even when the pool is empty they don't allow you to lay on a pool float in the pool. However, all the the other rules I like. I like the level of enforcement and the member participation and support of this. In the past, the singles weekend attracted a crowd that I didn't care for. If you are a new nudist couple I would recommend this resort. If you are a new nudist single male I would suggest maybe somewhere else. If you are going to specifically meet other nudist couples or singles I wouldn't recommend it. Seasoned true nudists are suspicious of new people whether couples or singles. They will assume you are up to no good. Experience has taught that many are. If you need a place to stay and you don't wear clothes then this place in the Best!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Kalamadrew
Reviews.Content: I just got back a couple days ago from 5 days at 2 resorts in Florida. The weather was OK - not great - but I got plenty of time in the sun. I arrived on the 18th and drove immediately to Cypress Cove in Kissimmee. It's about a 45 minute drive from Orlando Airport. I immediately felt welcome by the gate guard and the front desk staff. I checked in to a really nice hotel style room. It was a large room and had a table, couch, fridge, TV, coffee maker and a small TV I never used. There was high speed wireless with great connectivity and the room was 40 yards from one of the pools and hot tubs. As soon as I unpacked I hit one of the outdoor showers and the hot tub. I met a really nice permanent resident of the resort and we had a great chat. I felt welcome and included. One of my fears, as a single male, is that I would be ignored or worse but that never happened. Everyone was great the entire time. The next day I went to the pool area early, had a soak in the tub and stretched out on a chaise. People come over early to stake out their chairs for the day. They'll leave for a while but they come back and spend the rest of the day. I spent the day relaxing and reading. I spoke to the people next to me on both sides and they were great. For lunch I went to the bar between the pools. I had several meals there. The food was great, the prices reasonable, and the service fantastic. On Friday night I made reservations for the musical show in the restaurant. I went over nude but took a tee shirt "just in case" It became apparent that most people were coming in clothed so I put the shirt on. Ultimately only about 4 people stayed nude for the show. The show was really well done by the local "Players" and was a lip synching reprise of 50's-80's music. It was well done and everyone had a good time. The buffet was outstanding - fresh seafood, carved beef, desserts. Total price for the buffet and the show was $24. Overall - my stay at Cypress was simply outstanding and I'll be back. I'd recommend it to everyone. It's easy to get to, the people are great, the facilities are good to excellent, the lodging and food prices are comparable to a textile resort. The weather could have been a few degrees warmer but that's no fault of the resort. I'd rate my stay as 9 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “A bit too large and rules-oriented for our taste”
Reviews.Author: havanadaydreamer
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited for the weekend of October 2-4, 2009. The facilities are a little old but well maintained. There are three "sections" -- permanent residences (all mobile homes that have been made permanent with underpinnings and garages), a campground, and a resort consisting of four or five buildings. We stayed in the resort. One big plus is that it is only about 30 minutes from the Orlando airport. There are some nice recreation facilities. A couple of nice pools, one much larger than the other. The large pool is more crowded and fairly loud. The other pool is smaller but quieter, has a deep end and better for lap swimming. The large lake has free paddleboats.
