We just untied one and paddled around one morning. Nice tennis courts, surprising large fitness room, and a game room. (My first game of naked ping pong). Can also rent golf carts and bicycles. We rented 2 bicycles and rode throughout the complex. (Wish they had bicycle for two). Our room was 1162, a Villa Parlor Room in Villa 4. Dated but very clean. (Use the old plastic diamond-shaped door key holders that I haven't seen in years.) Refrigerator and coffee pot but no microwave. Also, there is NO ice machine on the premises. You must buy a big bag of ice from the office store ($1.50) but it will fit in the freezer part of the refrigerator just fine. Next to our room was a Villa apartment. The two units could be joined via connecting interior doors. Problem was that the doors were not close to being sound resistant. We could hear almost everything being said (or done!) in the apartment next to us. At times, it was almost as if they were in the room with us. Then there was the "rules" thing. There are members who patrol the resort, enforcing the rules. They reminded me of hall monitors in school. I thought they were a bit over the top. The pool is supposed to be all nude. A girl had got a bit too much sun, so she had a shirt on. One of the "guards" told her she had to be completely nude to be in the pool. What is the point of that rule? My girlfriend and I were hugging a bit in the smaller pool (that was all) and we got fussed at by one of the "guards." Told that this was a "family resort" and that they disapproved of such displays of affection. That was a downer. All-in-all it was a fun weekend and a nice resort. It was a little too big for our taste (we prefer something a bit more quaint) and then those stupid rules ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: DenitaLC
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old daughter and I spend 3 nights at Cypress Cove the last weekend of June, 2009. We had a wonderful time. The food at both the Riverside Restaurant and Cheeks was delicious and well priced. All of the staff members we encountered were friendly and helpful. The grounds are beautiful and tropical....just what you'd expect in Florida. The 50 acre lake was fun to canoe and paddleboat around on. The pool areas and amenities are the heart beat of the place with friendly guests from all over. (There is a nice playground for younger children.) My teen daughter had a blast and this was her first nude resort experience....she can't wait to go back next June! I especially love the family friendly atmosphere and true nudist values of Cypress Cove....parents can feel very comforable taking their kids to this wonderful resort! Activities: Tennis, pickleball, basketball, two swimming pools, hot tubs, fitness center (additional fee) recreation room with pool, ping pong. playground, chip & put mini golf course, RV parking, canoeing, paddleboats, fresh water lake, hotel rooms and suites, tent sites.

Reviews.Title: “3 days in paradise.”
Reviews.Author: rellio
Reviews.Content: Even though it rained every day. The room was perfect. The food was great! Don't miss this place.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: Alfred21526
Reviews.Content: Have vacationed at this resort for over 30 years and find it a great place to drop your clothes and your worries

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Great staff, great facilities, great ambiance!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSunandFun
Reviews.Content: This is the very best of nudist venues. Facilities are very well kept. AANR standards are taken seriously. Excellent dining at the Lakeside Restaurant or Cheeks Grille. Spa services were utilized with wonderful massage therapists and programs offered. Hair styling also used by both of us and very satisfactory results! Overall this is perhaps the very best nude resort in the USA. Staff are always working to make sure all is done right. Grounds and all recreational facilities are well kept. Office staff is very helpful and informative. Tennis, chip and putt golf, volleyball, basketball, shuffleboard, paddle boats on the lake, pools, hot tubs, bikes, and more. Rules are well posted and enforced. Many activities from active to educational. AANR library on site is very interesting. Don't miss this resort if a Nude vacation is of interest to you. Nothing but the very best! We are repeat visitors and each time it gets even better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: BeckyNW
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely week at Cypress Cove, despite Tropical Storm Fay washing out a couple of days! Lots of sunloungers, room for everyone to sit where they like and to move around during the day to get the best sun. Pretty good value at Cheeks Bar and the restaurant. In general people were pretty friendly but not too in-your-face. Almost everyone we met were Cove regulars, either living there or taking regular holidays there. The staff were lovely - helpful and attentive without rushing you. The motel room was spacious and comfy, with a good size fridge and a coffee maker (can be used to make tea if you prefer!). Overall a nice relaxed naturist resort with an older / family clientele. Go there to unwind. Don't go there if you are looking for excitement or swinging opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “Cypress Cove - Peaceful, Entertaining”
Reviews.Author: tripper6116
Reviews.Content: Sep 2007 A recent trip to Cypress Cove was way too short and the weather was perfect. The resort is very well maintained throughout. The rooms are modern, clean and spacious and close to all activities. Once you are within the boundaries of the resort, you can freely go anywhere and you can leave your clothes behind (we never locked our room so we didn't even need to carry keys). The lake is large and quite beautiful and you can canoe or paddleboat for hours. A walk about the neatly landscaped permanent homes is also a pleasant pastime. We played lots of tennis as the many courts are in excellent shape. There were also other activities including fitness classes, volleyball, petanque, etc. There are two beautiful, large pools and there is an outdoor and indoor spa. All are warm and inviting. Dining is primarily in the restaurant by the lake. This also houses a nice friendly bar and dance floor. The food, if not excellent, is good and very reasonably priced. The wine selections could use a little upgrading. We took our lunch by the pool at Cheeks Bar & Grill. During the day, that was quite an active place. The people, including the staff, were very friendly although most of the regulars seemed to keep more to themselves. But, since there were many vacationers, there was plenty of good conversation with what seemed to be a wholesome couples and family crowd. During our stay, we also enjoyed a couples massage which was relaxing, therapeutic and very reasonable. All in all, we found peace and serenity when we chose and entertainment when we wanted it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Cypress Cove Nudist Resort”
Reviews.Author: paradym
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a hotel rm at Cypress Cove for 4 enjoyable days. The dress was clothing optional and most people were nude 24 hours a day as we were. The atmostphere was truly a family nudist atmosphere with activities including exercise classes and other sports. The snack bar and especially the dining room offered good to excellent meals respectively. It was wonderful to dine while nude and watch the alligators play at the dock as we dined on some excellent blueberry pancakes at breakfast. The dinner menu was also pleasind with sufficient variety. The people were friendly but not intrusive. The behavior was all appropriate fun and relaxing true nudist lifestyle behavior as we observed. We plan to return and would reccomend this resort to both new and experienced nudists. The major amusement parks are also close by. We are from Virginia so the mild March weather in Central Florida was a welcomed experience. Cypress Cove is a 4.5 on a scale of 5 and the only thing we wish they had more of is green space. An excellent nudist resort.

HotelInfo.Name: Cypress Cove Nudist Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 4425 Pleasant Hill Rd, Kissimmee, FL 34746
